New music for April 2016

Written by Brandon King · Published Mar 29, 2016

Everything Youâ€™ve Come to Expect by The Last Shadow Puppets

Alex Turner and Miles Kane return with their follow up to 2008â€™s The Age Of The Understatement. This time round their songwriting was influenced by Isaac Hayes and The Style Council, as opposed to the Scott Walker influences of their first album.

Iâ€™ve Always Kept a Unicorn: The acoustic Sandy Denny by Sandy Denny

40-Track 2CD set captures Sandy at her most intimate as she runs through stripped down arrangements of songs with Straws, Airport Convention, Fotheringay, The Bunch and from her four solo albums.

Everything at Once by Travis

Fran Healy and Travis have had two No.1 albums, five Top Ten singles, two Brit Awards and more than 8 million record sales in their career to date. The new album promises the â€˜classic soundâ€™ of Travis for their fans. First single release 3 Miles High is an uplifting acoustic track, featuring backing vocals from up and coming Norwegian artist Aurora.

Super by Pet Shop Boys

13th studio album from the electronic duo with 12 new Tennant/Lowe compositions. There is also a tour later in the year including a four-night residency at Londonâ€™s Royal Opera House in July.

Honey by Katy B

Collaborative album featuring Craig David, Four Tet, Major Lazer and Novelist among others.

Cleopatra by The Lumineers

President Obamaâ€™s favourites return with their new album. Now that the nu-folk scene has faded will they be able to match their previous success?

Brandon King
